SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Our class has been given a pen pal assignment.

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: The teacher is making us write a letter and send it out.

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: I hope that my pen pal is at least cool?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: To my Assigned Pen Pal,

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: My teacher is making me write this letter. She’s very mean.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I don't like that she makes us do hard math problems.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: How about you? Do you hate math too?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Math is my worst subject. I’m really bad at numbers.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I really don’t want to write this letter either. It’s such a dumb thing to do.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: That’s really all I have to say.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Nice to meet you. I hope we can be friends.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: So write me back to me? I guess.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Write a letter back. Or not. I don’t really care.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: From, [player]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: As I passed my letter over, I began to wonder if I’ll get a response...

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: One week later...

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Once our teacher started handing out letters, I was surprised to see one with my name on it.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: To [player],

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I don’t know how this works but I hope you get this.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I think that homework assignments should be taken seriously no matter how mean your teacher is.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I’m actually pretty amazing at math. English isn’t my strong suit however.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: It’s completely understandable. Not everyone can be good at math.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: That’s rude to say to a stranger whom you’d rather not be writing to them. You did write the letter though so what does that say about you?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Other than that, I have nothing else to talk about.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: It’s very nice to meet you too. I would like to be friends as well.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: You’ve gotten a response back to your letter as you wanted. So what now?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: If you don’t care, then why are you even writing?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Sincerely, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: My pen pal seemed… interesting.

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: To my surprise, I wanted to see what else they had to say.

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: I took out another sheet of paper and started writing.

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: To [Pen pal]...

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Two years later...

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: As middle school started, the letters continued to pile.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: What’s up [player],

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I've attached some mad libs for us to play! Fill them out and I'll give you the completed version!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Regards, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Weeks pass...

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: What’s up [Pen pal],

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Ugh, I’m getting swamped with projects left and right.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’ve got an essay due tomorrow and I have to make a powerpoint for history.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Is there anything that you’re working on right now?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’m so tired. I can’t believe we have to do this much work just to get a good grade.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: At this point, I’m ready to copy/paste something from Wikipedia just to get it done.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: But I got on the basketball team recently and that’s been so cool.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’m just a bench warmer for now, but the coach told me that I might end up as a starter in like a month.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Man, I can’t wait! I’ll finally have a chance to impress that cute kid in my chem class.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Anyways I’ve got an algebra midterm next week and I’m ready to just

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: go to study sessions and use my notes to prepare.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: pull an all-nighter and cram the night before.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: cheat to get it over with, I’m pretty sure the one sitting next to me won’t mind.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: My brain’s pretty fried now, can you rec me some more songs, that band last time was pretty neat.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Later, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Some time later...

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Greetings [player],

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: It’s always nice to get a letter from you, especially when I’m busy with work.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I have a pretty big physics project that I have to present next week, but I’m confident I’ll do well.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I’ve been getting ahead of my projects unlike the other students in the class.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: In order to be successful, you need to put in hard work. It’s all worth it in the end.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Copying and pasting is not the right attitude to have. You’ll never learn anything that way.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: But wow the basketball team! Kudos to you [Player].

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Was tryouts difficult? Well maybe not, after all you’re going to be on the team in about a month.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: That’s pretty fast considering you’re a bench warmer right now.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I mean hey, maybe that cute kid won’t ignore you for long.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Also in regards to your midterm,

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: good luck on studying, I hope you do well!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: cramming the night before won’t help a lot. I suggest you start studying at least a couple days before.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Yikes. Cheaters never prosper, [Player].

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Anyways, I’ve been doing great in most of my honors classes.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: My teachers keep praising me and telling me that they recommend I move up a grade.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I’m not sure how to feel about that actually.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: But uh oh, a fried brain?!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Time to recommend the best beats I have!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: So turn this page around and you’ll find a list of songs I’d think you’ll like.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Regards, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: A couple months later...

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Greetings, [Player]

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I've got a new set of madlibs for you! Send them back when you fill it out and I'll give you the complete one!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Have fun, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Several months pass...

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Big news [Pen pal],

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I was talking to Stacey from my class today.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I mentioned you and she kinda looked at me funny.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: She said that she stopped talking to her pen pal a long time ago.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’m glad that we still talk to each other.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Do you think that it’s weird that we still send letters?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: She’s just mad at her bad luck.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: By the way, congratulations!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’m really glad for you winning that award, man! That’s so cool!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: You’re probably going to do great later on! Any tips on how to succeed as well as you do?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I don’t think I’m confident enough to do something like that because of the pressure.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Do you think you can share the prize you won with me?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Well, aside from school, how’s it going at home?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Also you should get this letter when you come back from vacation, so tell me about it!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Waiting for your next big adventure, [Player]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Some time later...

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Dearest [Player],

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Yeah, one of my classmates said the same thing.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: It’s sad that there’s not that many students writing to their pen pals anymore.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I’m glad to have you as my pen pal, too. Your letters never stop to amaze me.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I don’t think it’s weird that we still talk. We’re good friends. Maybe they just lost touch?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Don’t be so mean to Stacey. It doesn’t sound like she was being rude to you.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Anyway, thanks for the congratulations!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: It took awhile, but I put a lot of effort into this competition these last couple of months.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I’m far from doing great. I still have a long way to go. The only tip I have is to try your best.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: You should have more confidence in yourself. I believe that you can do anything you put your mind to.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Share my prize? That’s a hilarious joke, [Player]. Prizes ought to be earned on your own merit.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Smooth segue.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Home hasn’t changed a single bit, besides the nagging from my parents about my grades.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Our vacation was so exciting, so much cool stuff that you would like happened!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Please look forward to a postcard that I sent while we were there.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Tropically yours, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: We continued to send letters to each other even in high school.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Summer’s here [Pen pal]!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Do you remember on how I used to rant about finishing that one unbeatable video game a year ago?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Well guess who finally beat the final boss!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Your strategy helped a lot especially when the boss started healing itself.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Not me since I couldn’t finish the last QTE!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I used this one invincible hack that was posted online.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: But seriously!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’ve never felt so stressed in my life, and I thought finals were going to rip my brain in half.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Even the sun is planning to burn me into a crisp before the end of the day!

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Speaking of which, what are you planning to do this summer?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: My family has been bugging me for the past weeks. Do you have any suggestions?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Whenever one of my friends bring it up, I always end up shrugging at them.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: I’m probably going to be lazing around all day in bed, because boy I love sleep. Sleep is great.

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Anyways, what’s life like on your side?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: You skipped a bunch of grades and made it to college, but dang, what’s it like?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: You doing alright? Classes aren’t too tough on you, are they?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Is it like really different from high school?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: Is college full of nerds like you?

SPEAKER: player
TEXT: `Til next time, [Player]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: A week later...

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: How are you [Player],

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Yeah, I remember getting a two page report on how bad that dungeon crawler game was way back.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: You even tore a hole at the end of the page!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: My strategy wasn’t half bad right?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Aw, better luck next time then?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Shame on you. Hacks ruin everything!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Then again, most strategy based video games tend to add more stress than relieve it.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: But, we should be grateful that there’s no video game about finals.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: That would’ve been the number one horror game for almost everyone around the world.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Otherwise we all would prefer to be burnt to crisp than playing some game about finals.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Anyway, my plans for summer? I’m not sure yet.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I have a few suggestions for you in mind, what does your family prefer? Fun, educational, or complete relaxation?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I just can’t seem to come up with a quick response in time. I haven’t been thinking about vacation plans recently.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Sorry, I snorted there for a second. An image of a couch potato version of you came up in my mind.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: However everything at college has been going pretty smoothly.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I do get the odd look from other students, probably because they’re jealous.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I’m dealing with classes alright. Some of the professors are skeptical of me because they underestimate me, but I’m going to prove them wrong.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: College and high school aren’t super different. In fact, it’s a lot easier since you can choose when you want to take classes.

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Wow...rude. Are you trying to pick a fight with me through this letter, [Player]?

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Cordially yours, [Pen Pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: A couple months later...

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Greetings, [Player]

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: I've got a new set of madlibs for you! Send them back when you fill it out and I'll give you the complete one!

SPEAKER: pal
TEXT: Have fun, [Pen pal]

SPEAKER: narrative
TEXT: Our letter exchange continued even into my college years.
